channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘His divorce lawyer was completely useless’: My husband is on the mortgage of his ex-wife’s house. She’s behind on the loan. What can we do?
item.description: ‘If he contacts the bank and asks to remove his name from the mortgage because he has no legal responsibility, will they force her to refinance?’

item.title: ‘I don’t want the government involved in my affairs’: My husband lists me as his beneficiary. We don’t have children. Do we need a will?
item.description: “My concern is that there would be some involvement by the state that would cost me.”

item.title: ‘I’ve nothing saved for retirement’: I’m 50 and earn $45,000. I don’t have a 401(k) match. Should I put 10% of my salary in a Roth IRA instead?
item.description: “I currently have $36,000 in student-loan debt in forbearance in the SAVE program.”

item.title: Hong Kong Shares End Higher; Auto, Entertainment Stocks Lead Gains
item.description: The Hang Seng closed slightly higher supported by auto and entertainment stocks, with investors closely watching for announcements related to the upco...

item.title: Ten-year Treasury yields slip to one-month low as traders return after Thanksgiving
item.description: Bond yields dipped early Friday as the market re-opened following the Thanksgiving break.

item.title: My liberal sister wants to school me on the ‘real causes’ of inflation. Trump and politics are off limits for Thanksgiving. What’s left to talk about?
item.description: “My sister, who is a lifelong Democrat, wanted to school me on everything from the “real” causes of inflation to immigration.”

item.title: Investors Could Bet on 10-Year Treasury-Bund Yield Spread Widening
item.description: Investors should take advantage of the current relief phase to add to Treasury-Bund yield spread widening positions, Commerzbank Research said, which ...

item.title: Wall Street's Response to More Tariffs: Been There, Done That
item.description: Traders aren’t thrilled about the return of Donald Trump’s tariff threats. But they are hardly panicking.

item.title: Oil Prices Mixed Amid Thin Trading Volumes
item.description: Oil prices were mixed in early Asian trade amid thin trading volumes. Geopolitical tensions appeared to be easing momentarily as Israel and Hezbollah ...

item.title: End-of-Month Factors Hit Dollar, But Fundamental Outlook Is Strong
item.description: The dollar was lower against other major currencies as end-of-month portfolio rebalancing and thin holiday trading volumes weigh on the currency, Brow...
